ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Level 22 woes (or why Unrest STILL sucks)  LONG
ygData.msgSnippet: I m not sure what you re considering pulses . Hymn of Restoration has a duration of approximately 10 - 12 seconds Most of our DoT s have a duration of about
ygData.messageBody:
I'm not sure what you're considering 'pulses'.

Hymn of Restoration has a duration of approximately 10 - 12 seconds
Most of our DoT's have a duration of about 15 - 18 seconds
(I'm not positive on the time as lag/network latency could be throwing off
my timer)

So, if you mean it doesn't last as long as a DOT you are correct, however it
does last long enough to sing a medly of 3 songs.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath
----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Cc: <-@...>
Sent: Tuesday, March 07, 2000 3:22 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Level 22 woes (or why Unrest STILL sucks) LONG


> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Mon, 6 Mar 2000, Nathaniel Clark wrote:
> >
> > I am not certain that four song weaving is beneficial over three. I
tried
> > throwing in either bellow and/or chains with some twists. Unless you
can
> > minimize the time with just 3 song coverage (to one second or less), you
> > are probably losing more in terms of efficiency than you are gaining
with
> > extra damage or slow down effect.
>
> Most of our songs are 2 pulses. Fire up Hymn and immediately
> turn it off, and your hp will increment only twice. The 3
> pulse notion came about because depending on when your song
> hits the server in its heartbeat cycle, it can "last" anywhere
> from 2.00 to 2.99 pulses (and the time to start up the song
> "adds" a half pulse subjectively).
>
> DoTs seem to be 3 pulses. I've been meaning to test them with
> Rokenn in the arena. If they are indeed 3 pulse songs, then
> you have a bit more flexibility when weaving them.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
